title._content: ["Hickory Hill," Colonel Henry Taylor Wickham house, Ashland, Virginia. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Hickory Hill," Colonel Henry Taylor Wickham house, Ashland, Virginia. Elise W. B. Wickham at end of boxwood walk] [1927] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: House circa 1875. Landscape: Willliam Fanning and Mary (Mrs. William F.) Wickham, begun 1820. Other: Originally part of the Shirley Plantation. Today: House extant. On slide (handwritten): "Hickory Hill, Wickham, Tree box." On slide (printed): "Edward Van Altena" (slide manufacturer, probably 71-79 W. 45th St., New York, N.Y.C. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 233. Subjects: Gardens--Virginia--Ashland--1920-1930. Trees--Virginia--Ashland--1920-1930. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1920-1930. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16267 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 58
